title: BMW 118 review: does petrol power make this the pick of the premium hatchbacks?
text:
The BMW 1 Series is a car that simply can’t help being heretic. In 2004, when it first appeared on our streets, dyed-in-the-wool BMW enthusiasts were aghast. A proper BMW was a saloon or a sports car, they grumbled, not some jumped-up hatchback; the 1 Series would cheapen the brand, and BMW would rue the day, and that was an end of it.

Since then, the 1 Series has in fact become one of BMW’s most important cars. This despite its rear-wheel-drive layout, an attempt to keep it feeling like a traditional BMW as much as possible, which seriously hampered its ability as a family hatchback by compromising space in the back seats and boot.
